text: if you are directed by Kate Shortland
lore is about five destitute siblings in
southwestern Germany in the final days
of World War two in his review Stephen
Holden writes Kate Shortland Lord is not
a fairy tale but it feels like one a
dark mysterious fable of hungry
frightened children making their way
through a perilous enchanted forest
inhabited by the film sustains an air of
overarching mystery in which the viewers
are in the position of a sheltered child
plunked into an alien environment and
required to fend for themselves without
map or compass until the children reach
their destination laura seems to exist
in a surreal timeless limbo in which
horror mingles with beauty you are
acutely aware of the contrast between
the numbing citizenry they encounter and
the magnificence and indifference of the
natural world
